Identification.LongTitle: An Act to implement the Agreement between Canada, the United States of America and the United Mexican States

Provision.Text: Her Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate and House of Commons of Canada, enacts as follows:

Section.Text: This Act may be cited as the Canada–United States–Mexico Agreement Implementation Act.
The following definitions apply in this section and sections 3 to 20.

Definition.Text: Agreement means the Agreement between Canada, the United States of America and the United Mexican States, done at Buenos Aires on November 30, 2018, as amended by the Protocol of Amendment to the Agreement between Canada, the United States of America and the United Mexican States, done at Mexico City on December 10, 2019. (Accord)
Commission means the Free Trade Commission established under the Agreement and whose powers, functions and duties are set out in Chapter 30 of the Agreement. (Commission)

federal law means the whole or any portion of an Act of Parliament or a regulation, order or other instrument issued, made or established in the exercise of a power conferred by or under an Act of Parliament. (texte législatif fédéral)

Minister for the purposes of any provision of this Act, means the member of the Queen’s Privy Council for Canada designated as the Minister for the purposes of that provision under section 10. (ministre)

North American Free Trade Agreement means the North American Free Trade Agreement between Canada, the United States of America and the United Mexican States, done at Mexico City, Ottawa and Washington, on December 17, 1992. (Accord de libre-échange nord-américain)

Section.Text: For greater certainty, this Act and any federal law that implements a provision of the Agreement or fulfils an obligation of the Government of Canada under the Agreement is to be interpreted in a manner consistent with the Agreement.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-application of Act and Agreement to water
Section.Text: For greater certainty, nothing in this Act or the Agreement applies to natural surface or ground water in liquid, gaseous or solid state.

For greater certainty, nothing in this Act, by specific mention or omission, is to be construed to affect in any manner the right of Parliament to enact legislation to implement any provision of the Agreement or fulfil any of the obligations of the Government of Canada under the Agreement.
This Act is binding on Her Majesty in right of Canada.
The principal purpose of this Act is to implement the Agreement, the objectives of which, as elaborated more specifically through its provisions, are to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: replace the North American Free Trade Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: establish a free trade area in accordance with the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: further support mutually beneficial trade between the parties to the Agreement as well as their economic growth;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: preserve and expand regional trade and production by further incentivizing the production and sourcing of goods and materials in the territories of the parties to the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: establish a clear, transparent, and predictable legal and commercial framework for business planning that supports further expansion of trade and investment, including in the online environment and in creative and innovative sectors;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: promote efficient and transparent customs procedures that reduce costs and ensure predictability for importers and exporters;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: recognize the right of the parties to the Agreement to regulate, in accordance with the rights and obligations provided for in the Agreement, in order to protect legitimate public welfare objectives;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: recognize the right of the parties to the Agreement to adopt or maintain measures with respect to cultural industries in accordance with the rights and obligations provided for in the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: facilitate trade in goods and services between Canada and the other parties to the Agreement by preventing, identifying, and eliminating unnecessary technical barriers to trade, by enhancing transparency, and by promoting good regulatory practices;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: support the growth and development of small and medium-sized enterprises by enhancing their ability to participate in and benefit from the opportunities created by the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: promote high levels of environmental protection through, among other means, the effective enforcement of environmental laws, enhanced environmental cooperation and mutually supportive trade and environmental policies and practices;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: promote the protection and enforcement of labour rights and the improvement of working conditions;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: promote transparency, good governance and the rule of law, while eliminating bribery and corruption in trade and investment;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: recognize the importance of increased engagement by Indigenous peoples in trade and investment; and

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: facilitate women’s and men’s equal access to and ability to benefit from the opportunities created by the Agreement and support the conditions for women’s full participation in domestic, regional, and international trade and investment.

Section.MarginalNote: Causes of action under sections 9 to 20

Subsection.Text: No person has any cause of action and no proceedings of any kind are to be taken, without the consent of the Attorney General of Canada, to enforce or determine any right or obligation that is claimed or arises solely under or by virtue of sections 9 to 20 or an order made under any of those sections.

No person has any cause of action and no proceedings of any kind are to be taken, without the consent of the Attorney General of Canada, to enforce or determine any right or obligation that is claimed or arises solely under or by virtue of the Agreement.
Subsection (2) does not apply with respect to causes of action arising out of, and proceedings taken under, Annex 14-C of the Agreement.

Heading.TitleText: Approval, Designation of Minister and Representation on Commission

Section.Text: The Governor in Council may, by order, designate any member of the Queen’s Privy Council for Canada to be the Minister for the purposes of any provision of this Act.
The Minister is the principal representative of Canada on the Commission.
The Secretariat established under paragraph 1 of Article 2002 of the North American Free Trade Agreement is continued as the Secretariat that is to be established under Article 30.6 of the Agreement.

Section.MarginalNote: Continuation of Canadian Section of Secretariat
Section.Text: The Canadian Section of the Secretariat that is referred to in section 14 of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act is continued within the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development for the purpose of performing the functions set out in paragraph 3 of Article 30.6 of the Agreement.

Subsection.Text: There is to be a Secretary of the Canadian Section of the Secretariat to be appointed in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act.
The Secretary is responsible for fulfilling the Section’s mandate. In doing so, the Secretary is to perform the functions set out in paragraph 3 of Article 30.6 of the Agreement.

Section.Text: Officers and employees who are required for the proper conduct of the work of the Canadian Section of the Secretariat are to be appointed in accordance with the Public Service Employment Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Powers of Minister — Chapter 10 of Agreement

Subsection.Text: The Minister, with the concurrence of the Minister of Finance, may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appoint panellists in accordance with paragraphs 2 and 3 of Annex 10-B.1 of the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: appoint a committee member in accordance with paragraph 1 of Annex 10-B.3 of the Agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: propose the names of individuals for a roster referred to in Annex 10-B.1 or 10-B.3 of the Agreement.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Powers of Minister — Chapter 31 of Agreement
Subsection.Text: The Minister may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appoint panellists in accordance with Article 31.9 of the Agreement;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: propose the names of individuals for a roster referred to in Article 31.8 of the Agreement; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: propose the names of individuals for the lists referred to in Article 31-B.3 of Annex 31-B of the Agreement.

Section.Text: The Minister of Labour may act as Canada’s senior governmental representative on the Labour Council referred to in Article 23.14 of the Agreement or may designate that representative.
The Government of Canada is to pay its appropriate share of the aggregate of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any expenditures incurred by or on behalf of the Commission,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the general expenses incurred by the committees, working groups and other subsidiary bodies established under the Agreement and the remuneration and expenses payable to representatives on the Commission and those committees and to members of those working groups and other subsidiary bodies,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the general expenses incurred by the committee referred to in paragraph 1 of Annex 10-B.3 of the Agreement and the remuneration and expenses payable to the members of that committee, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the expenses incurred by panels established under the Agreement and the remuneration and expenses payable to the panellists on those panels, and to any experts retained by those panels.

Subsection.Text: The Governor in Council may, for the purpose of suspending benefits in accordance with Article 31.19 of the Agreement, by order, do any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: suspend rights or privileges granted by Canada to another party to the Agreement or to goods, service suppliers, investors or investments of investors of that party under the Agreement or any federal law;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: modify or suspend the application of any federal law, with respect to a party to the Agreement other than Canada or to goods, service suppliers, investors or investments of investors of that party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: extend the application of any federal law to a party to the Agreement other than Canada or to goods, service suppliers, investors or investments of investors of that party; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: take any other measure that the Governor in Council considers necessary.

Subsection.Text: Unless repealed, an order made under subsection (1) has effect for the period specified in the order.
Paragraph (1)(a) does not apply in respect of rights and privileges that are referred to in Section D of Chapter 10 of the Agreement or granted under the Special Import Measures Act.

Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply in respect of any provision of the Special Import Measures Act or of the regulations made under that Act that implements a right or privilege referred to in Section D of Chapter 10 of the Agreement.

On the recommendation of the Minister, the Governor in Council may, for the purpose of imposing remedies in accordance with Article 31-B.10 of Annex 31-B of the Agreement, by order, do any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: suspend rights or privileges granted by Canada to another party to the Agreement or to service suppliers or goods of that party under the Agreement or any federal law;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: modify or suspend the application of any federal law, with respect to a party to the Agreement other than Canada or to service suppliers or goods of that party;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: extend the application of any federal law to a party to the Agreement other than Canada or to service suppliers or goods of that party; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: take any other measure that the Governor in Council considers necessary.

Subsection.Text: Before making a recommendation to the Governor in Council, the Minister must consult the Minister of Finance if the proposed remedies include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: suspending or withdrawing rights or privileges granted by Canada under the Customs Tariff;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a measure described in paragraph 53(2)(b) or (d) of that Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a measure described in paragraph 53(2)(c) of that Act that is related to a measure referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) of this subsection.

Subsection.Text: Unless repealed, an order made under subsection (1) has effect for the period specified in the order.
An order made under subsection (1) may, if it so provides, have retroactive effect.
Paragraph (1)(a) does not apply in respect of rights and privileges that are referred to in Section D of Chapter 10 of the Agreement or granted under the Special Import Measures Act.

Paragraph (1)(b) does not apply in respect of any provision of the Special Import Measures Act or of the regulations made under that Act that implements a right or privilege referred to in Section D of Chapter 10 of the Agreement.

Section.Text: Sections 6.1, 6.2 and 11.1, paragraphs 23(1)(a) and (b) and subsection 23(1.1) of the Copyright Act, as enacted by sections 24, 26 and 29, respectively, do not have the effect of reviving the copyright or a right to remuneration in any work, performer’s performance fixed in a sound recording or sound recording in which the copyright or the right to remuneration had expired on the coming into force of those provisions of that Act.
In sections 106 and 107, commencement day means the day fixed under subsection 213(1).

Proceedings that are pending under the Special Import Measures Act immediately before the commencement day and that are in relation to goods of a NAFTA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(1) of that Act as it read immediately before that day, are continued under that Act as it reads on that day and the proceedings are deemed to be in relation to goods of a CUSMA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(1) of that Act as it reads on that day.

If proceedings under the Special Import Measures Act are commenced on or after the commencement day in respect of goods that were imported before the commencement day and that were, on the day on which they were imported, goods of a NAFTA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(1) of that Act as it read immediately before the commencement day, the proceedings are deemed to be in relation to goods of a CUSMA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(1) of that Act as it reads on the commencement day.
In sections 150 and 151, commencement day means the day fixed under subsection 213(1).

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), proceedings that are pending under the Canadian International Trade Tribunal Act immediately before the commencement day and that are in relation to goods of a NAFTA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(2) of that Act as it read immediately before that day, are continued under that Act as it reads on that day and are deemed to be in relation to goods of a CUSMA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(2) of that Act as it reads on that day.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of inquiries under section 19.01 or any of subparagraphs 26(1)(a)(i.1), (i.2) or (i.3) of that Act.

Section.Text: If proceedings under the Canadian International Trade Tribunal Act are commenced on or after the commencement day in respect of goods that were imported before the commencement day and that were, on the day on which they were imported, goods of a NAFTA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(2) of that Act as it read immediately before the commencement day, the proceedings are deemed to be in relation to goods of a CUSMA country, as that expression is defined in subsection 2(2) of that Act as it reads on the commencement day.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (4), this Act comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.
Sections 21 and 153 to 182 come into force on the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day before the first anniversary of the day fixed under subsection (1).

Subsection.Text: Subsection 114(1), section 115, subsection 118(1) and sections 119, 121 to 126, 128, 130, 132 and 135 come into force on the sixth anniversary of the day fixed under subsection (1).
Subsection 137(1) comes into force on a day to be fixed by order of the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Act, other than section 21, subsection 114(1), section 115, subsection 118(1), sections 119, 121 to 126, 128, 130, 132 and 135, subsection 137(1) and sections 153 to 182 in force July 1, 2020, see SI/2020-33, as amended by SI/2020-46; subsection 114(1), section 115, subsection 118(1) and sections 119, 121 to 126, 128, 130, 132 and 135 in force July 1, 2026; sections 21 and 153 to 182 in force June 30, 2021.]

Provision.Text: Agreement within the meaning of subsection 2(1) of the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act
Agreement within the meaning of section 2 of the Canada–Peru Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act
Agreement within the meaning of section 2 of the Canada–Colombia Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act
Agreement within the meaning of section 2 of the Canada–Panama Economic Growth and Prosperity Act
Agreement within the meaning of section 2 of the Canada–Honduras Economic Growth and Prosperity Act
Agreement within the meaning of section 2 of the Canada–Korea Economic Growth and Prosperity Act
Agreement within the meaning of section 2 of the Canada–European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement Implementation Act
Agreement within the meaning of section 2 of the Canada–United States–Mexico Agreement Implementation Act
